means: （昔日的）沿街呼唤传报消息的人

sentence.Network_en: Now the crier called the train ready and they got on.
sentence.Network_cn: 这时,站台上的人高声喊着火车要开了,于是他们上了车.

sentence.Network_en: When he had finished his roll on the drum, the town - crier read out his notice.
sentence.Network_cn: 镇上传达公告的人打完了他的这通鼓以后, 就朗诵告示.

sentence.Network_en: This was where the town crier cried the news.
sentence.Network_cn: 这就是街头宣告员大声宣布新闻的地方.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French criere, from crier 'to shout'

means.word_mean: 2. (formerly) an official who made public announcements
3. a peddler who shouts to advertises the goods he sells

auth_sentence.content: Mr Stubbings was a sergeant in the Parachute Regiment for 17 years and town crier for Lincoln for 14 years.
